page.title: 15Dollymans Farm,Rawreth
page.content: Dollymans is a heavy clay farm of about 120 hectacres,growing wheat, barley,rape and peas.100 Friesan cows are milked twice a day in a herring- -bone parlour.The cowman, who lives on the farm,begins his day at 5.30 a.m. by bringing in the cows from the field. Milking takes about one and a half hours.Whilst in the parlour cows receive cereal protein cubes.After milking the cows return to the field and the cowman cleans up the parlour. The second milking begins at 4.15.The cows are housed from November until April.Each cow has a separate cubicle and can lie down on a straw bed.Winter feed is silage and cubes.Cows calve in the early Autumn and give about 6800 litres of milk during a 305 day lactation.
